author: cf0009
content: why are blocktimes so random? Sometimes we see blocks in 15 seconds. Sometimes every 2 mins. And those 2 min blocks always double the gas and upset the whole network

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: Blocktimes are effectively a Poisson distribution: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poisson_distribution

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: Even in the presence of stable hashrate, miners are searching for blocks / nonces that satisfy the difficulty condition. This is entirely random, so sometimes they find multiple solutions quickly... sometimes they find it just as quickly as they do on average.
